section.hand:
To my L. T
re
r June 6 1591

page.lettertext:
fol.162r
Belgia. 1591 6 June To my L. Trea
s
Belgia: 1591: June:
May it please yo
r
good L. the bearer hereof
John
[Marshe]
, having
s
ved a long time in these contreys
was taken prisoner by
e Ennemy about 15 weekes past &
brought p
nt
ly to
Bolduc,
& from thense to
Bruxels
& last of
all to
Anwerpe.
In
e time of his imprisonm
t
hee had
conference in Bruxels w
th
one
John Dannport
a cheshir
gentleman, & a pensioner for
e
K. of Spaine
. Who seeming
to bee weary of
e King
service, & desirous to forsake
e
company of
e English fugitives discovered his minde to this
bearer & willed him w
th
out
all delay to repaire into
England
&
there notifie speedely, that there were certain Englishmen
in Bruxels w
ch
had a mischievous practise in hand
upon her
Ma
t
shippes. for
e effecting wh
r
of they had
sent certain mariners into England appareled like Burgers
w
ch
were addressed to a dutch mans house in
St Katherins
neer to
e Towne, who bestoweth them in
s
vice in
e
foresaid shippes, w
th
instruction to watche an opportunity
to sett them on fire. The truthe hereof I know no
otherwise but by his owne report, who as far as I can
ceave hath no other proofe nor conjecture, but by
e speeches
of John Dannport. W
ch
also I know not how truly he
avoucheth. Nevertheles because he offreth of himself to
make this voyage, requiring nothing of mee but to give
him meanes by a l
re
unto yo
r
L. or some oth
r
of my LL.
to have accesse I thought to write thus much by him
& to signify heer unto him, that if by his travell &
s
vice
the
ties bee descried hee will be well rewarded, oth
r
wise
I could make him no
mise, nor he might not build
upon it, for his onely good will & this bare
declaration to receave any recompense
& Thus &c.
June 6 1591.
